data.text: @EdTubb At that rate, >50% the current unvaxxed 70+ population of Ontario will be dead in less than 5 years.

@EdTubb not all PHUs are capturing all,they r not including all seniors residences within their boundaries.Some use FSAs to determine cases, they are leaving out shared FSAs within their boundaries.Nobody cares, not Public Health,notDr.Moore vulnerable r being discriminated against imho https://t.co/2zETIC4eRr

@EdTubb @EmmaRoseTeitel If you want to keep wearing mask you are welcome too, but mask mandates should be lifted.  Don’t judge people who continue to wear masks and also people that do not.   Time to treat this like anything else and move on with our lives.  

About time Ontario lifted mask mandates!
@AlexEhbee @EnthusiastHyzer @EdTubb And fewer young people get symptoms, so they wouldn't even know to test in the first place.

@Longham77 @EnthusiastHyzer @EdTubb Makes me wonder if the unvaccinated also happen to be younger and healthier on average than the vaccinated, which would also contribute to lower testing rates for those with symptoms.
@AlexEhbee @EnthusiastHyzer @EdTubb Case in point: the unvaxxed case rate was nearly the same as the fully vaxxed yesterday (7.24/100k vs. 7.52).

@AlexEhbee @EnthusiastHyzer @EdTubb Another reason could be that unvaccinated people simply could not congregate in public confined spaces (restaurants, sporting arenas), due to the vaccine passports. Now that this is a thing of the past, I would expect the rates to even out again, or even swing back the other way.
@EnthusiastHyzer @EdTubb The other reason is that there are more vaccinated people.
@EdTubb too bad that doesn't take into account all cause mortality.
@EdTubb 0 doses, had Omicron and not dead yet. FFS 🤦🏽‍♀️
